text.0: may the milchcows who hasten to their object come harmless unto us with liquid sweetness.
text.1: the singer lauding calls for ample riches the seven mighty ones who bring enjoyment.
text.2: with reverence and fair praise will i bring hither for sake of strength exhaustless earth and heaven.
text.3: father and mother sweetof speech fairhanded may they farfamed in every fight protect us.
text.4: adhvaryus make the sweet libations ready and bring the beautiful bright juice to vāyu.
text.5: god as our priest be thou the first to drink it we give thee of the mead to make thee joyful.
text.6: two armsthe somas dexterous immo latorsand the ten fingers set and fix the pressstone.
text.7: the stalk hath poured fair with its spreading branches the meads bright glittering juice that dwells on mountains.
text.8: the soma hath been pressed for thee its lover to give thee power and might and high enjoyment.
text.9: invoked turn hither in thy car o indra at need thy two welltrained and dear bay horses.
text.10: bring by godtraversed paths accordant agni the great aramati celestial lady.
text.11: exalted worshipped with our gifts and homage who knoweth holy law to drink sweet soma.
text.12: as on his fathers lap the son the darling so on the fire is set the sacred caldron.
text.13: which holy singers deck as if extending and heating that which holds the fatty membrane.
text.14: hither as herald to invite the aśvins come the great lofty song most sweet and pleasant.
text.15: come in one car joygivers to the banquet like the bolt binding pole and nave come hither.
text.16: i have declared this speech of adoration to mightiest pūṣan and victorious vāyu.
text.17: who by their bounty are the hymns inspirers and of themselves give power as a possession.
text.18: invoked by us bring hither jatavedas the maruts all under their names and figures.
text.19: come to the sacrifice with aid all maruts all to the songs and praises of the singer.
text.20: from high heaven may sarasvatī the holy visit our sacrifice and from the mountain.
text.21: eager propitious may the balmy goddess hear our effectual speech our invocation.
text.22: set in his seat the god whose back is dusky bṛhaspati the lofty the disposer.
text.23: him let us worship set within the dwelling the red the goldenhued the allresplendent.
text.24: may the sustainer high in heaven come hither the bounteous one invoked with all his favours.
text.25: dweller with dames divine with plants unwearied the steer with triple horn the lifebestower.
text.26: the tuneful eloquent priests of him who liveth have sought the mothers bright and loftiest station.
text.27: as living men with offered gifts and homage they deck the most auspicious child to clothe him.
text.28: agni great vital power is thine the mighty pairs waxing old in their devotion seek thee.
text.29: may every deity be swift to listen and mother earth with no ill thought regard me.
text.30: gods may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.
text.31: may we obtain the aśvins newest favour and gain their healthbestowing happy guidance.
text.32: bring riches hither unto us and heroes and all felicity and joy immortals.
